pullRequest.title: Fixing flaky tests. Making changes to not attempt to connect to cloud…
pullRequest.bodyText:
… if device is not configured to
Issue #, if available:
Description of changes:
Fixing flaky test

An integ test on mac was trying to install docker leading to test timeout. Removed installing docker from the config since the test is about checking if services start as expected
ServiceDependencyLifecycleTest  was expecting installed states to be in certain order which is a wrong expectation.

Changing the behavior when Device is not configured to talk to cloud. If device was not configured then it was still trying to connect to cloud. Changed the behavior such that device does not do that.
Changed the minimum jacoco integration coverage ratio to 0.56 since I have changed the code path in IotJobsHelper which changes code path to not execute unecessary code. Due to this coverage in windows gets lowered from 0.57 to 0.56.
Why is this change necessary:
How was this change tested:
Any additional information or context required to review the change:
Checklist:

 Updated the README
Not applicable

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

nodes.bodyText:
👍
We can even reduce the checklist to
new ExpectedStateTransition(HardDependency, State.INSTALLED, State.STARTING), 
new ExpectedStateTransition(CustomerApp, State.INSTALLED, State.STARTING),
new ExpectedStateTransition("main", State.STOPPING, State.FINISHED)));
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -123,23 +124,23 @@ void GIVEN_hard_dependency_WHEN_dependency_goes_through_lifecycle_events_THEN_cu
         kernel = new Kernel().parseArgs("-i", configFile.toString());
 
         // WHEN_kernel_launch_THEN_customer_app_starts_after_hard_dependency_is_running
-        LinkedList<KernelTest.ExpectedStateTransition> expectedDuringLaunch = new LinkedList<>(
-                Arrays.asList(new KernelTest.ExpectedStateTransition(CustomerApp, State.NEW, State.INSTALLED),
-                        new KernelTest.ExpectedStateTransition(HardDependency, State.NEW, State.INSTALLED),
-                        new KernelTest.ExpectedStateTransition(HardDependency, State.INSTALLED, State.STARTING),
-                        new KernelTest.ExpectedStateTransition(HardDependency, State.STARTING, State.RUNNING),
-                        new KernelTest.ExpectedStateTransition(CustomerApp, State.INSTALLED, State.STARTING),
-                        new KernelTest.ExpectedStateTransition(CustomerApp, State.STARTING, State.RUNNING),
-                        new KernelTest.ExpectedStateTransition("main", State.STOPPING, State.FINISHED)));
-        testRoutine(TEST_ROUTINE_SHORT_TIMEOUT, kernel, kernel::launch, "kernel launch", expectedDuringLaunch, Collections.emptySet());
+        LinkedList<ExpectedStateTransition> expectedDuringLaunch = new LinkedList<>(
+                Arrays.asList(
+                        new ExpectedStateTransition(HardDependency, State.INSTALLED, State.STARTING),
+                        new ExpectedStateTransition(HardDependency, State.STARTING, State.RUNNING),
+                        new ExpectedStateTransition(CustomerApp, State.INSTALLED, State.STARTING),
+                        new ExpectedStateTransition(CustomerApp, State.STARTING, State.RUNNING),
+                        new ExpectedStateTransition("main", State.STOPPING, State.FINISHED)));
+

commit.message: Fixing flaky tests. Making changes to not attempt to connect to cloud if device is not configured to
Increasing timeouts for tests as they fail on windows
Adding method in ServiceDependencyLifecycleTest to verify state transitions not in any specific order
